unnormalised: Income Tax Dept. extends ITR filing deadline! Initially, the last date to file your ITR was 31st July 2024, but good news, guys! It’s been extended to 31/08/2024. So, breathe easy!
normalised: Income Tax Department extends I-T-R filing deadline! Initially, the last date to file your I-T-R was thirty first July two thousand and twenty four, but good news, guys! It's been extended to thirty first August two thousand and twenty four. So, breathe easy!

unnormalised: This extension is a huge relief, especially for those who were struggling to gather all the necessary documents. Tax experts like CA R.K. Gupta were expecting this considering the server issues reported on incometax.gov.in last week. Remember to file before the new deadline!
normalised: This extension is a huge relief, especially for those who were struggling to gather all the necessary documents. Tax experts like C-A R.K. Gupta were expecting this considering the server issues reported on incometax.gov.in last week. Remember to file before the new deadline!

unnormalised: Don’t wait till 31/08/2024 though! File ASAP to avoid any last-minute glitches. Also, note that this extension is only for filing ITR; there's no change in the deadline for paying advance tax. The interest rate u/s 234A will still be applicable post the original deadline if taxes are due.
normalised: Don't wait till thirty first August two thousand and twenty four though! File A-S-A-P to avoid any last-minute glitches. Also, note that this extension is only for filing I-T-R; there's no change in the deadline for paying advance tax. The interest rate under section two hundred and thirty four A will still be applicable post the original deadline if taxes are due.

unnormalised: For more details, visit the Income Tax Department's website or consult your trusted CA. Make sure to download Form 16 from your employer and keep all your investment proofs handy before you start the process. Happy filing!
normalised: For more details, visit the Income Tax Department's website or consult your trusted C-A. Make sure to download Form sixteen from your employer and keep all your investment proofs handy before you start the process. Happy filing!
